sponsor: Cubist Pharmaceuticals LLC, a subsidiary of Merck & Co., Inc. (Rahway, New Jersey USA)
briefTitle: Study Comparing the Safety and Efficacy of Intravenous CXA-201 and Intravenous Meropenem in Complicated Intraabdominal Infections
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Phase 3 Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Intravenous CXA-201 With That of Meropenem in Complicated Intraabdominal Infections

arms.label: CXA-201 and Metronidazole as treatment for cIAI

summary: This is a Phase 3, multicenter, prospective, randomized, double-blind, double dummy study of CXA-201 Intravenous (IV) infusions (1500mg q8h) and metronidazole (500mg q8h) versus meropenem (1000mg q8h)for the treatment of adults with Complicated Intraabdominal Infections (cIAI).

primaryOutcome.measure: The Percentage of Subjects With Clinical Outcome of Cure at the Test of Cure (TOC) Visit in the Microbiological Intent to Treat (MITT) Population
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: TOC; 26-30 days after start of study drug administration

effectByArm.arm: CXA-201 and Metronidazole as Treatment for cIAI
